title: 05. Athenian Law Courts
description: Key features of the Athenian law courts: selection of dikastai, jury sizes, case types, and trial procedure.

questions.question: How many dikastai were appointed each year to serve in the Athenian law courts?
How were dikastai selected each year?
What was the minimum age requirement to serve as a dikast?
How many dikastai were drawn from each tribe annually?
What device was used to allocate dikastai to courts on the day of a trial?
Why were Athenian juries deliberately large?
options: To reduce the risk of bribery

questions.question: What sizes could Athenian juries take?
Why were jury numbers always odd?
Who was responsible for bringing most legal cases in Athens?
What was a dikē?
options: A private lawsuit by the injured party

questions.question: What type of case was a graphē?
options: A public lawsuit for offences against the community

questions.question: When could a citizen bring charges against a magistrate during euthunai?
options: At the end of the magistrate’s term

questions.question: How were speeches timed during trials?
How did dikastai cast their votes?
What happened if a defendant was found guilty?
options: Both sides proposed penalties and the jury chose

questions.question: What aspect of the law courts does Aristophanes’ Wasps particularly highlight?
options: The obsession of elderly jurors with jury service
